ygData.subject: Re: Re:What to buy?
ygData.msgSnippet: Thanks, and yea, I agree, I really didn t go hard core EQ till I was about 16th level, and only reason I did then was because I was getting really bored
ygData.messageBody:
Thanks, and yea, I agree, I really didn't go hard core EQ till I was about
16th level, and only reason I did then was because I was getting really
bored waiting for that big FD. Best thing for a monk to do would be to get
that cured silk or mesh, which ever is more redily available and then just
save and wait for good items to present themselves at good costs. It's what
I did, I just happen to have gotten some really good opertunities.

Shelza 18th, karana


>From: Clarity <roderick.duncan@...>
>Reply-To: EQ-Monks@onelist.com
>To: EQ-Monks@onelist.com
>Subject: [EQ-Monks] Re:What to buy?
>Date: Sun, 06 Feb 2000 15:20:52 -0500
>
>My apologies, Shelza, I was too quick to judge your intentions there.
>However I still think Harrick is far better off ignoring equipment for the
>moment. The best equipment he could save up for right now would be:
>
>Onyx earrings (2 agi) 5pp or so from Blackburrow
>Spiked collar (ac3 3str) 5pp or so from Blackburrow
>Lockjaw vest (ac12 5sta) 20-30pp from Oasis
>Bracer of erolisi (ac5 5str) 25-30pp from Ocean of Tears
>
>The Wu's gauntlets is not worth the money for him right now.
>
>To be perfectly honest, Shelza, cured silk can stay in a lot of locations
>on a
>monk until he or she hits the planes. Swap out to gear that gives you
>better
>AC/HP than cured as you can afford it, but it's only going to make a
>marginal improvement in combat performance for each piece of armor you
>trade out. Levels and skills are what this game is really about.
>
>
>Clarity Harvestmoon,
>Karana
